title: Chord: 11th in D# (Shape: G)
content:
# Chord: 11th in D# (Shape: G)

## Brief Presentation
The 11th chord in the key of D# is formed using the G chord shape. It includes the notes D#, G, A#, C#, F, and G. This chord has a rich and complex sound due to the presence of the 11th interval, which adds color and depth to the harmony.

## Notes and Intervals
- D# (Root)
- G (Major 3rd)
- A# (Perfect 5th)
- C# (Major 7th)
- F (Major 11th)
- G (Root)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 11th chord in D# is often used in jazz and R&B music due to its sophisticated and jazzy sound. It adds a sense of tension and release to the music and creates a lush harmonic texture. This chord can also be found in neo-soul and funk genres, adding a modern and soulful flavor to the music.

## Songs
1. **"So What" by Miles Davis** - This jazz classic features the 11th chord in D# to create a cool and modal jazz sound.
   
2. **"Untitled (How Does It Feel)" by D'Angelo** - In this R&B hit, the 11th chord in D# is used to add soulful and jazzy harmonies to the music.

3. **"Redbone" by Childish Gambino** - This modern funk track uses the 11th chord in D# to create a smooth and groovy vibe.
